Tasted February 19, 2015. EYE: Bright ruby color, brick red ring. NOSE: Blackberry, mild scents of smoke and licorice, not a complex bouquet. MOUTH: Progressive attack, a mild acidity, tannins come first, then blackberry, unripe raspberry and licorice. AFTERTASTE: Long caudalies, some astringency, mint. IMPRESSION: A pleasant wine with dominant braquet grapes. Still young, to drink now or in 1-3 years (I don't think it would improve after that). PS: It is an AOC Bellet, not Bordeaux as stated.
